intro: Dodecadia agrestis, commonly known as the rough dodecadia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and is adapted to dry, well-drained soils. Its leaves are rough and hairy, and it produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer. Dodecadia agrestis is often found in open areas and is relatively drought-tolerant.
